tourBios.curYrHigh: Carded a bogey-free 7-under par 65 to finish T4 at the Puerto Rico Classic presented by Merrill Lynch for his first top-25 of the season on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. It was also his best career finish on the Tour. Earned his Tour card via a regional exemption awarded to Argentina.
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Had four top-25 finishes and made seven cuts in ten starts during the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. Finished No. 75 in the Order of Merit to lose his Tour card. His best finish and only top 25 was T15 at the Olivos Golf Classic-Copa Personal in December… Finished T25 at the Panama Claro Championship on the Web.com Tour… Won the 81st Abierto OSDE del Centro in Cordoba, Argentina on the Tour de las Americas in April. Over a span of two and a half years collected ten top-3 finishes on the TLA

2011: Won the 51st Abierto Internacional de Golf Copa Sura in Medellin, Colombia in July on the Tour de las Americas. That victory helped him finish the season ranked No. 3 on the TLA Order of Merit, a position that allowed him to earn his card for the 2012 season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica.

2010: As winner of the VISA Open de Argentina he was awarded a sponsor exemption into the PGA TOUR's Puerto Rico Open. Posted rounds of 76 and 70 to miss the cut at 146 (+2).

2009: Won the 104th playing of the VISA Open de Argentina at Nordelta Golf Club. That Tour de las Americas' event has been his most relevant career victory. 

2005: Won his first career title at the Abierto de Misiones on the Argentine Tour.

2004: Started his international career on the Tour de las Americas.

2001: Started his professional career by competing on the Argentine Tour.
tourBios.personal: Full name is César Agustín Costilla… Wife, Mónica Sáenz (married on November 10, 2004)… Has two daughters: Martina (born on July 8, 2001) and Delfina (September 5, 2006)… Started in golf as a caddie at the age of 13 at the Jockey Club de Tucuman, a club he remains affiliated to... Florentino Molina, Mariano Bartolomé and Ezequiel Fonseca have been his golf instructors… Olivos Golf Club in Buenos Aires, Argentina is his favorite golf course… Argentina's River Plate is his favorite professional team… Favorite entertainer is Argentine actor Francella… His favorite food is the Argentine style asado (barbeque)… Favorite vacation spot is Mar del Plata, Argentina… A frog and the Superman logo can be seen as special headcovers on his bag… Tiger Woods, Sergio García and Ernie Els would round out his dreamed foursome.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Carded a bogey-free 7-under par 65 to finish T4 at the Puerto Rico Classic presented by Merrill Lynch for his first top-25 of the season on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. It was also his best career finish on the Tour. Earned his Tour card via a regional exemption awarded to Argentina.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was T3rd in 2015 at the Roberto De Vicenzo Punta del Este Open Copa NEC.
